newsitem.title: USA: Ford offers stock purchases for new investors.
newsitem.headline: Ford offers stock purchases for new investors.

text.p: Ford Motor Co said Wednesday it established a stock purchase program for new investors.
Under the plan, with an initial investment of $1,000, new investors can buy their first shares directly from the company, it added.
Unlike some other stock purchase programs, investors are not required to own Ford stock before participating, the automaker added.

Other features of the plan include additional periodic purchases through automatic bank withdrawals, an individual retirement account that invests in Ford common stock, arrangement of loans or lines of credit that are backed by Ford stock, and transactions handled by telephone, Ford said.

The plan also allows dividends to be reinvested in full or in part in Ford stock or received in cash; purchases in whole dollar amounts rather than a specified quantity of shares; transfers or gifts with no transfer or certificate fees; and shares to be sold at any time at low cost.
Subsequent purchases of Ford stock require a minimum of $50, the company said.

For investors new to Ford, automatic deductions from a bank account require a $100 minimum and at least 10 consecutive investments. Once the minimum purchase commitment is met, additional investments may be made for as little as $50, it added.
